results.title: Menace
results.brief_description: The early Cold War years in Australia were characterised by attempts to suppress political dissent including the banning of the Communist Party. Here we see the experience from the perspective of those who defended democratic freedoms. This is a critical look at the Australian political scene from the end of World War II to the commencement of hostilities in Korea. Emphasis is placed on the events surrounding the Communist party Dissolution Bill, the High Court judgement declaring the Act invalid and the 1951 referendum defeat in which Prime Minister Menzies unsuccessfully asked the Australian people to change the constitution and make the Communist Part Dissolution Bill law.

results.title: Men without faces
results.creator_credit: Dennis A. Hill and New South Wales. Dept. of Prisons
results.brief_description: This film describes the NSW penal system and explains the efforts made by prison officers to rehabilitate prisoners. Shows how hardened prisoners enter Grafton Gaol, a prison of bars and locks, while those who show promise of reforming are sent to training centres in Goulbourn, Berrima and Emu Plains where they are taught trades and how to live in a community, preparation for the day of their release.

results.title: Men who molest
results.brief_description: This program is an investigation of four men who have exhibited a range of molestation behaviour. Three of them are in treatment at the largest American community-based facility. The documentary examines the therapy that these men undergo in an attempt to control their behaviour and it emphasises the importance of therapy for this complex social problem.

results.title: Men who make a difference
results.brief_description: Who are the men who lead the boys in the scouting movement in America? Explains the motivations and the satisfactions of being a Scoutmasters. It also interprets for the general public Scouting’s united leaders and their special contributions.

results.title: Men who come back
results.brief_description: Deals with the safety precautions found necessary in most Ohio industries, such as a clean well-arranged shop, safety guards on machines, correct materials, handling techniques, the use of safety goggles and competent first aid treatment.

results.title: Men on the mend
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: An employee injured in the Western Region Railway Workshops goes to the Rehabilitation Workshop at Swindon. There, together with other men, he exercises his injured limb on machines especially built or adapted for the purpose, and turns out articles necessary to British Railways. After a reduced period convalescence he returns, fully recovered to duty.

results.title: Men of the light ships
results.brief_description: Dramatised documentary about life aboard a british naval light ship during wartime, describing what happens during an attack by enemy bombers. Music by Richard Addinsell.

results.title: Men of the footplate
results.brief_description: Presents the work of ayoung man wishing to join the railway. Harry begins working at British Railway as a cleaner. He learns the names and functions of the steam locomotion parts he cleans. His eagerness leads him to progress to the role of fireman, hoping to eventually become a driver. Commentary by Frank Phillips.

results.title: Men of Capricorn
results.creator_credit: Barbie Smith and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The variety of the country and the people of the Capricorn region of Queensland. Cattle and sheep grazing in the country surrounding Longreach, which is the market centre and shore worn; oil waiting to be struck; the Moura open-cut coal mines; and nearer the coast the Callide open cut; Mount Morgan copper, gold and silver mines; on the coast Rockhampton is the terminal for coals, minerals, wool and beef, and the beginning of the railway into the heart of Queensland.

results.title: Men of Canungra
results.brief_description: Shows methods of training at the Jungle Training Centre at Canungra to achieve proficiency in jungle warfare. Tactics are shown being discussed. Combat survival training, physical toughening up, jungle craft and techniques lead up to the successful ambush and defeat of enemy troops by a jungle patrol.
